EXTRACTED VALUE: It's actually pretty entertaining, though almost completely uninspired.
It's got bottomless depth, good AI and everything we loved so much about the series. It just doesn't have much new stuff to talk about.
A slick yet largely routine exercise in jumping, balancing, and fast-twitch hand-eye coordination. [Sept 2007, p.76]
Soltrio Solitaire is a rip off. It's that simple. It's overpriced and it under-delivers.
If you have some vision, creative ambition, and a whole lot of time on your hands, RPG Maker just may be the game for you.
A decent (albeit uninspired) title which, while hardly pushing the Xbox 360 - or your IQ - to its limits, offers pretty good value for money.
Fatal's look hasn't exactly aged well, and SNK has done little to update the graphics. [Dec 2007, p.78]
Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer is yet another example of movie tie-ins failing to even come close to their potential.
Started as a cool idea, but its flashes of quality are too short to sustain long term interest.
Geon: Emotions is a pretty cute and easy to learn puzzle game on Xbox Live but nothing spectacular or addicting.
For me, I will stick with "Madden." "Gameday 2001" is still stuck in training camp.
